column4: how can I restart the gdm as sudo service gdm restart does not work in natty (Im using xfce4)
you can restart the entire x.org subsystem with ALT-PrntScr-K
what was it alt printscreen and k?
so how can I just stop it?
you want just KDE, or the apps that go along with a Kubuntu install?
you'll be given a choice about which you want to run at the login screen
why? just logout and back in.
you'll be able to choose an XFCE or KDE session from the login screen
that's not going to do it, though.
you can stop a display manager all you want. it's not going to change what session starts when you login.
Ah ok so if my system start s as xfce4 and I drop to a tty and stop xfce4 and start kde this is not possible as it wil go to the dm menu?
I want xfce4 to start by default as it does with auto login and then when in xfce Id like to drop to a tty kill xfce4 and start kde is this possible? or must I logout of xfce4 and then login to kde?

I want xfce4 to start by default as it does with auto login and then when in xfce Id like to drop to a tty kill xfce4 and start kde or unity is this possible? or must I logout of xfce4 and then login to kde? I haven't tried kde in years or unity yet...:D
